channel.title: What classic server source do you recommend?
channel.description: I've been fiddling with a hyperion server, until I thought, "Why not go back to the good ol' days." So now I'm wondering what Runescape classic server sources you guys recommend. From what I've read, it seems like most people like moparclassic. If I use that, should I clone the pre-beta branch, or the master branch? If I shouldn't use that, what else should I use? Thanks in advance!

item.title: What classic server source do you recommend?
item.dc:creator: @RylandAlmanza RylandAlmanza
item.description:
@RylandAlmanza wrote:

Wife Beater:

Im working offline so can you put it as 127.0.0.1? also my email is snemosdn@aol.com could you send it to that? Would be heavily appreciated

Sent. Let me know if you have any problems.

Read full topic

item.title: What classic server source do you recommend?
item.dc:creator: @RylandAlmanza RylandAlmanza
item.description:
@RylandAlmanza wrote:

[quote=“Wife Beater, post:17, topic:452884”][quote author=RylandAlmanza link=topic=555752.msg4068769#msg4068769 date=1344159843]

If you’re new to Java, I’d recommend Noobscape. Otherwise DarkQuest, I dislike Moparclassic.

Thanks imthenull. Took me a while, but I got DarkQuest all set up. I’ll probably write up a tutorial tommorrow for setting up a DarkQuest server.
[/quote]

How did u get the client to work? It says cannot find itemdef class, when its clearly in there :S do u mind letting me have your client copy? :)[/quote]
Of course! Just let me know what your IP address is (I have to put it in the code,) and I’ll compile you a full working DarkQuest client.

Read full topic

item.source: What classic server source do you recommend?

item.title: What classic server source do you recommend?
item.dc:creator: @CodeForFame CodeForFame
item.description:
@CodeForFame wrote:

[quote=“latifundio, post:8, topic:452884”][quote author=CodeForFame link=topic=555752.msg4068934#msg4068934 date=1344179375]

What don’t you like about MoparClassic?

scala? must be the best anti-leech ever lol.
[/quote]What do you mean? You can write Scala code that is nearly identical to Java…

What i mean is that ppl see the scala parts of the server and ditch it right away (or is the ivy thing?). Look at how even moparisthebest says “PURE jAVA” ;D

For me doesn’t matter since i’m more interested in editing landscape, sprites and quests to my liking.[/quote]The whole hex thing was originally dependent on an entire library. It was then moved to a single Scala class (only because the single line of Scala couldn’t be written in the Java class it was being used in). Then MITB found a clever way to get it to a single line of Java. Anyway, it wasn’t about wanting to ditch Scala, it was about having less useless classes.

Also, what would you rather use instead of Ivy? Maven? ROFL

[quote=“imthenull, post:11, topic:452884”][quote author=CodeForFame link=topic=555752.msg4068818#msg4068818 date=1344166573]
What don’t you like about MoparClassic?
[/quote]
it’s got too much ‘work’ on it[/quote]What do you mean?

[quote=“RylandAlmanza, post:14, topic:452884”]Alright, I got moparclassic pre-beta login server and game server running. Now I’m having trouble finding a client. Can someone point me in the right direction? Thanks![/quote]https://github.com/xetr0v/mpc-client

Read full topic

item.title: What classic server source do you recommend?
item.dc:creator: @imthenull imthenull
item.description:
@imthenull wrote:

CodeForFame:

What don’t you like about MoparClassic?

it’s got too much ‘work’ on it

latifundio:

scala? must be the best anti-leech ever lol.

Actually I’m fluent in scala.

-Nothing:

Because there’s nothing for him to rip off it. tehehe.

That’s hard for you to say, and I’m capable of writing better systems for content than you ever will.

Read full topic

item.title: What classic server source do you recommend?
item.dc:creator: @latifundio latifundio
item.description:
@latifundio wrote:

I voted for MSC since a LOT of things where rewritten for stability (man a fork even has a new script system for npcs) but i need to say that playing with DQ has been a lot of fun and that’s the best way to learn stuff.
